Class CcddTableTreeHandler

    public class CcddTableTreeHandler
extends CcddCommonTreeHandler
    CFS Command and Data Dictionary table tree handler class
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • CcddTableTreeHandler

        CcddTableTreeHandler(CcddMain ccddMain,
                     CcddGroupHandler groupHandler,
                     CcddConstants.TableTreeType treeType,
                     boolean getDescriptions,
                     boolean sortByName,
                     boolean showGroupFilter,
                     boolean showTypeFilter,
                     boolean addHiddenCheckbox,
                     java.lang.String rateName,
                     java.lang.String rateFilter,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedVariables,
                     boolean isSilent,
                     java.lang.String prototypeNodeName,
                     java.lang.String instanceNodeName,
                     java.awt.Component parent)
        Table tree handler class constructor
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        groupHandler - group handler
        treeType - table tree type (TableTreeType)
        getDescriptions - true if the node descriptions are to be added as tool tips
        sortByName - true to sort the child structures by variable name; false to show in the order defined in the structure
        showGroupFilter - true to display the group filter check box
        showTypeFilter - true to display the type filter check box
        addHiddenCheckbox - true to add a hidden check box under the filter check boxes for alignment purposes
        rateName - data stream rate column name used to filter the table tree for variables with rates
        rateFilter - data rate used to filter the table tree for variables with rates
        excludedVariables - list of node paths to be excluded from the table; null or empty list if no exclusions
        isSilent - true if any errors when building the tree are not annunciated via a warning dialog
        prototypeNodeName - name of the prototype node; null to set the node to which the prototype node would normally belong as the prototype node
        instanceNodeName - name of the instance node; null to set node to which the instance node would normally belong as the instance node
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • CcddTableTreeHandler

        CcddTableTreeHandler(CcddMain ccddMain,
                     CcddGroupHandler groupHandler,
                     CcddConstants.TableTreeType treeType,
                     boolean showGroupFilter,
                     boolean addHiddenCheckbox,
                     java.awt.Component parent)
        Table tree handler class constructor
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        groupHandler - group handler
        treeType - table tree type (TableTreeType)
        showGroupFilter - true to display the group filter check box
        addHiddenCheckbox - true to add a hidden check box under the filter check boxes for alignment purposes
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • CcddTableTreeHandler

        CcddTableTreeHandler(CcddMain ccddMain,
                     CcddGroupHandler groupHandler,
                     CcddConstants.TableTreeType treeType,
                     java.lang.String rateName,
                     java.lang.String rateFilter,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> excludedVariables,
                     java.lang.String prototypeNodeName,
                     java.lang.String instanceNodeName,
                     java.awt.Component parent)
        Table tree handler class constructor. Get just the tree information of the specified type
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        groupHandler - group handler
        treeType - table tree type (TableTreeType)
        rateName - rate column name used to filter the table tree for variables with rates
        rateFilter - data rate used to filter the table tree for variables with rates
        excludedVariables - list of node paths to be excluded from the table; null or empty list if no exclusions
        prototypeNodeName - name of the prototype node; null to set the node to which the prototype node would normally belong as the prototype node
        instanceNodeName - name of the instance node; null to set node to which the instance node would normally belong as the instance node
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • CcddTableTreeHandler

        CcddTableTreeHandler(CcddMain ccddMain,
                     CcddGroupHandler groupHandler,
                     CcddConstants.TableTreeType treeType,

                     java.awt.Component parent)
        Table tree handler class constructor
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        groupHandler - group handler
        treeType - table tree type (TableTreeType)
        prototypeNodeName - name of the prototype node; null to set the node to which the prototype node would normally belong as the prototype node
        instanceNodeName - name of the instance node; null to set node to which the instance node would normally belong as the instance node
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

                     CcddConstants.TableTreeType treeType,
                     boolean isSilent,
                     java.awt.Component parent)
        Table tree handler class constructor. Get just the tree information of the specified type. Structure variable tables and primitives retain their order of appearance in the table's definition
        Parameters:
        ccddMain - main class
        treeType - table tree type (TableTreeType)
        isSilent - true if any errors when building the tree are not annunciated via a warning dialog
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • buildTableTree

        protected void buildTableTree(java.lang.Boolean isExpanded,
                              java.lang.String rateName,
                              java.lang.String rateFilter,
                              java.awt.Component parent)
        (Re)build the table tree from the currently table information
        Parameters:
        isExpanded - true if all tree nodes should be expanded, false to collapse all nodes, and null to use the current status of the expansion check box (if present; if not present then use false)
        rateName - rate column name used to filter the table tree for variables with rates; null if the tree is not filtered by data rate
        rateFilter - data rate used to filter the table tree for variables with rates; null if the tree is not filtered by data rate
        parent - component building this table tree

      • setInvalidNodesAndTrim

        private boolean setInvalidNodesAndTrim(java.util.List<java.lang.String> validTables,
                                       CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node)
        Starting with the specified node, traverse down its branch and flag as invalid any node where the name doesn't match one in the supplied list of tables. The match criteria accounts for filtering by type, by group, or by both type and group. A list of nodes to remove is created, based on the match criteria and the filter(s). This is a recursive method
        Parameters:
        validTables - list of table names belonging to the filtered selection; null if no filtering
        node - node to test for validity
        Returns:
        true if the supplied node has a descendant that's in the valid tables list

      • buildTopLevelNodes

        private void buildTopLevelNodes(java.util.List<java.lang.String> validTables,
                                CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode instNode,
                                CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode protoNode,
                                java.awt.Component parent)
        Build the top-level nodes for the table tree (based on the selected filters). Remove any nodes that are flagged for removal based on the valid tables criteria and the type/group filters (if these are enabled)
        Parameters:
        validTables - list of table names belonging to the filtered selection; null if no filtering
        instNode - parent node for the top-level nodes
        protoNode - parent node for the prototype nodes
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • buildNodes

        private void buildNodes(CcddClassesDataTable.TableMembers thisMember,
                        CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode parentNode,
                        CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode childNode)
        Build the table tree nodes. This is a recursive method. In order to prevent an infinite loop, a check is made for a child node that exists in its own path; if found the recursion is terminated for that node
        Parameters:
        thisMember - TableMember class
        parentNode - current working node for the table tree
        childNode - new child node to add to the working node

                                               java.lang.String dataType)
        Get the description for the specified table
        Parameters:
        tablePath - root table and variable path for the table
        dataType - table data type
        Returns:
        The description for this table. If this is an instance of a table and no specific description exists for it then use the prototype table's description. If the prototype table has no description then return null

      • getTableTreePathList

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTableTreePathList(java.lang.String searchName)
        Search the entire table tree and get the list of paths where the node contains the search table's name. If no search name is provided then a list of all nodes is returned. The paths are in the form of comma-separated node names, with any HTML tags removed
        Parameters:
        searchName - name of table to search for in the node names; null to get all paths for the parent node
        Returns:
        List of paths to the nodes matching the search table's name, or all nodes if the search name is null

      • getTableTreePathList

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTableTreePathList(java.lang.String searchName,
                                                                CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode startNode,
                                                                int maxLevel)
        Search the table tree starting at the specified node and get the list of paths where the node contains the search table's name. If no search name is provided then a list of all nodes is returned. The paths are in the form of comma-separated node names, with any HTML tags removed
        Parameters:
        searchName - name of table to search for in the node names; null to get all paths for the parent node
        startNode - starting node
        maxLevel - only paths that are at a level less than or equal to this value can be added to the list; -1 to to ignore the path level
        Returns:
        List of paths to the nodes matching the search table's name, or all nodes if the search name is null

      • getTableTreePathArray

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> getTableTreePathArray(java.lang.String searchName,
                                                                   CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode startNode,
                                                                   int maxLevel)
        Search the table tree starting at the specified node and get the list of path arrays where the node contains the search table's name. If no search name is provided then a list of all nodes is returned. The paths are in the form of arrays, with any HTML tags preserved
        Parameters:
        searchName - name of table to search for in the node names; null to get all paths for the parent node
        startNode - starting node
        maxLevel - only paths that are at a level less than or equal to this value can be added to the list; -1 to to ignore the path level
        Returns:
        List of paths to the nodes matching the search table's name, or all nodes if the search name is null

      • pruneTreeToSearchCriteria

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> pruneTreeToSearchCriteria(java.lang.String searchText)
        Beginning with the root node, remove tree nodes that do not match the specified search text and are not an ancestor of a node that does contain a match.
        Parameters:
        searchText - text for which to search (regular expression is allowed)
        Returns:
        List of paths for the nodes matching the search text; an empty list if there are no matches

      • addTableAncestors

        protected void addTableAncestors(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tablePaths,
                                 boolean includeAncestorPrototype)
        Add the ancestor instance tables for each table path in the supplied list. Based on the input flag also add the prototype tables for every table and ancestor in the list. No duplicate table references are included in the list
        Parameters:
        tablePaths - list containing the table paths in which to search
        includeAncestorPrototype - true to also include the prototype for all instance tables

      • getSelectedTablesWithChildren

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectedTablesWithChildren()
        Get a list of the tables (with their paths) represented by the selected nodes. If a header node (i.e., a non-table node, such as a group or type node) is selected then all of its child tables are added to the list. HTML tags are removed from the returned table path+names
        Returns:
        List containing the table path+names of the selected node(s) with no duplicate table references and with any HTML tags removed

      • getTablesWithChildren

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTablesWithChildren(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tables)
        Get a list of the specified table name(s), and include all descendant tables for those tables that are root structures. The node with the default instance node name is used to search for root table descendants. HTML tags are removed from the returned table path+names
        Parameters:
        tables - list of tables for which the descendants are required
        Returns:
        List containing the table path+names of the specified table(s) with the descendants of these tables (if applicable and any exist) and with any HTML tags removed

      • getSelectedTablesWithoutChildren

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectedTablesWithoutChildren()
        Get a list of the tables (with their paths) represented by the selected nodes. If a header node (i.e., a non-table node one level above a table node, such as a group or type node) is selected then its descendants are checked, recursively, until the level containing tables is found; these tables are added to the list. If a selected node isn't a header node then ignore the node if it has a selected ancestor node. HTML tags are removed from the returned table path+names
        Returns:
        List containing the table path+names of the selected node(s) with any HTML tags removed

      • getTablesWithoutChildren

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTablesWithoutChildren(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node)
        Get a list of the table names that are the descendants of the specified node (do not include any duplicates or children of these descendants, if any). HTML tags are removed from the returned table path+names. This is a recursive method
        Parameters:
        node - tree node for which to get the table names
        Returns:
        List containing the table path+names of the specified node, excluding any duplicates and children of these descendant tables, with any HTML tags removed

        Get a list of the group nodes that are selected. Deselect of the group's child nodes and the group node itself
        Returns:
        List containing the selected group name(s)

      • setNodeEnableByChildState

        private boolean setNodeEnableByChildState(CcddClassesComponent.ToolTipTreeNode node)
        Set the node text color based on the enable state of its child nodes. If all children are disabled then disable the parent, otherwise enable the parent. This is a recursive method
        Parameters:
        node - node for which to adjust the text and color
        Returns:
        true if the node is enabled; false if disabled

      • createTreePanel

        protected javax.swing.JPanel createTreePanel(java.lang.String label,
                                             int selectionMode,
                                             boolean isAllowHighlight,
                                             java.awt.Component parent)
        Create a table tree panel. The table tree is placed in a scroll pane. A check box is added that allows tree expansion/collapse
        Parameters:
        label - table tree title; null to not display a title
        selectionMode - tree item selection mode (single versus multiple)
        isAllowHighlight - true to allow highlighting of text in the node names
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
